Docs.summary: This class represents the specification logic for AppSearch.

remarks.para: This class represents the specification logic for AppSearch. It can be used to set the type of search, like prefix or exact only or apply filters to search for a specific schema type only etc.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the list of document ids to search over.

remarks.para: Returns the list of document ids to search over.
If empty, the query will search over all documents.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the list of namespaces to search over.

remarks.para: Returns the list of namespaces to search over.
If empty, the query will search over all namespaces.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the list of package name filters to search over.

remarks.para: Returns the list of package name filters to search over.
If empty, the query will search over all packages that the caller has access to. If package names are specified which caller doesn't have access to, then those package names will be ignored.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the map of schema and target properties to search over.

remarks.para: Returns the map of schema and target properties to search over.
If empty, will search over all schema and properties.
Calling this function repeatedly is inefficient. Prefer to retain the Map returned by this function, rather than calling it multiple times.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the list of schema types to search for.

remarks.para: Returns the list of schema types to search for.
If empty, the query will search over all schema types.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns a map from schema type to property paths to be used for projection.
Docs.value: A mapping of schema types to lists of projection PropertyPath objects.

remarks.para: Returns a map from schema type to property paths to be used for projection.
If the map is empty, then all properties will be retrieved for all results.
Calling this function repeatedly is inefficient. Prefer to retain the Map returned by this function, rather than calling it multiple times.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Calling this function repeatedly is inefficient. Prefer to retain the Map returned by this function, rather than calling it multiple times.

This member is deprecated. use #SCHEMA_TYPE_WILDCARD instead.

Docs.summary: Gets a tag to indicate the source of this search, or null if Builder#setSearchSourceLogTag(String) was not called.

remarks.para: Gets a tag to indicate the source of this search, or null if Builder#setSearchSourceLogTag(String) was not called.
Some AppSearch implementations may log a hash of this tag using statsd. This tag may be used for tracing performance issues and crashes to a component of an app.
Call Builder#setSearchSourceLogTag and give a unique value if you want to distinguish this search scenario with other search scenarios during performance analysis.
Under no circumstances will AppSearch log the raw String value using statsd, but it will be provided as-is to custom AppSearchLogger implementations you have registered in your app.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.AppSearch.SearchTermMatch TermMatchExactOnly = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.AppSearch.SearchTermMatch enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.AppSearch.SearchTermMatch enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: Query terms will only match exact tokens in the index.

remarks.para: Query terms will only match exact tokens in the index.
For example, a query term "foo" will only match indexed token "foo", and not "foot" or "football".
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.App.AppSearch.SearchTermMatch TermMatchPrefix = (2)

[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.App.AppSearch.SearchTermMatch enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: Query terms will match indexed tokens when the query term is a prefix of the token.

remarks.para: Query terms will match indexed tokens when the query term is a prefix of the token.
For example, a query term "foo" will match indexed tokens like "foo", "foot", and "football".
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
